verbs.description: imbue (third-person singular simple present imbues, present participle imbuing, simple past and past participle imbued)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wet or stain an object completely with some physical quality.
examples: The shirt was imbued with his scent.

entries.meaning: In general, to act in a way which results in an object becoming completely permeated or impregnated by some quality.
examples: The entire text is imbued with the sense of melancholy and hopelessness.
